results.title: Don't be the last to know (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Aviva Ziegler, Film Australia and Stephen Ramsey
results.brief_description: Introduced by Mike Willesee - this video provides an in-depth look at two Australian families and their fight against drug addiction. Typical families with day to day problems like everyone else - until a serious drug problem surfaced. Addicts and their families speak frankly about their frustration, confusion and the courage needed to fight back. Essential viewing for all parents.

results.title: Don't be a dummy
results.creator_credit: Verity Films, Central Electric Authority, Oswald Skilbeck and Joe Mendoza
results.brief_description: Details of safety precautions to be taken in certain operations and maintenance work associated with electricity generating stations, the underlying principle being the permit-to-work. Deals with such things as towing ropes, coal bunkers, and conveyors, boiler blow-down valves, and jib and overhead cranes and trucks.

results.title: Don't be a carrier
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture, Australian Agricultural Council and Jack Keane
results.brief_description: Illustrates how plant pests and diseases are spread by the carelessness of travellers carrying fruit, vegetables and plants across State borders. Strict quarantine regulations have been enforced to prevent the spread of disease to the Murray and Barossa Valleys. In South Australia, free of Black Spot and Codlin Moth, the importation of apples from interstate or overseas is prohibited. In recent years, Fruit Fly has been introduced into Victoria and South Australia necessitating costly spraying and destruction of fruit in infected areas, an undertaking which is the result of carelessness of a few individuals in the community.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture, Australian Agricultural Council and Jack Keane

results.title: Don's Party [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Art House Productions, Phillip Adams and Bruce Beresford
results.brief_description: Bruce Beresford’s classic Australian comedy exposes Australian social mores in the suburbs. Don and Kath have invited a group of friends to celebrate what they believe will be a Labor Party victory on Election night. The night begins happily enough until the guests receive the news that Labor is losing. Old enmities erupt as hostilities break out amongst the guests as the party disintegrates into an alcoholic disaster. Cast includes Ray Barrett, Graham Kennedy, John Hargreaves, Graeme Blundell, Jeanie Drynan and Clare Binney. DVD special two-disc collectors’ edition containing a ‘must see’ interview-style documentary (over two hours long), researched, edited and directed by Mark Hartley. Feature only also available on VHS [307072].

results.title: Dominga
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, J.-P. Olivier Fougeres, Peter Hollander, Peter McCaw and Guy L. Cote
results.brief_description: The Aymara Indians of Bolivia lead a harsh existence. This film describes the efforts of the government of Bolivia to implement the UN World Food Program in this poor agricultural community where there is a high child-mortality rate. The main character is Dominga, as president of a local group, is helping her people to adjust to new methods and food products in order to improve living standards.

results.title: Dominators: Smith, Hayes, Cummings (S)
results.brief_description: Bart Cummings, Colin Hayes and Tommy Smith, Australia’s legendary trio of racehorse trainers. Their notoriety extends beyond the profession they have dominated for decades. Each of them possess a natural affinity with the horse: individually gifted with that enigmatic sixth sense. Record breaking achievements distinguish them from their contemporaries by the length of the Flemington straight. Their amazing winning formula applies not to hundreds of races, but thousands. Between them they’ve won 73 Derbies, 50 Oaks, 11 Cox Plates, 13 Melbourne Cups and 11 Golden Slippers. This is their success story.
